issues.details: Tariff on Korean cars reduced to 15% retroactively from Novemberâ€¯1, 2025, potentially affecting importers and domestic markets.

responses.clarification: The reduction is part of the USâ€‘Korea trade agreement and the MOU, intended to benefit US industry and workers.

evaluations.opinion: The tariff reduction is expected to strengthen US industry and labor, aligning Korean tariffs with Japan and the EU.

confirmed_facts: US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick confirmed Korean car tariffs will be reduced to 15% retroactive to Novemberâ€¯1, 2025.
The reduction is part of the USâ€‘Korea trade agreement and the MOU signed on Decemberâ€¯14, 2025.

timeline.event: USâ€‘Korea Strategic Investment MOU signed, stipulating retroactive tariff reduction.
Korean Democratic Party introduced the Special Law for Strategic Investment in the National Assembly.
Howard Lutnick announced the 15% tariff reduction retroactive to Novemberâ€¯1.
